metadata.feature_description: Post wiki activities to user and group activity journals

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Wiki articles appear in Activity Feed

steps.action: Navigate to Wiki Test page and enter edit mode
steps.expected: Wiki module is visible with existing articles
steps.actual: Wiki module displayed with 2 existing articles (Test Article for Revision Management, Test Article for Metadata)

steps.expected: Activity Feed shows wiki article journal entries
steps.actual: Activity Feed displayed multiple wiki article entries showing 'authored wiki article' for Test Article for Search, Test Article for Bookmarks, Test Article for Revision Management, and Test Article for Metadata

steps.action: Scroll to view additional journal entries
steps.expected: Multiple wiki journal entries visible with article links and summaries
steps.actual: Multiple wiki journal entries visible showing article titles, summaries, timestamps, and social actions (Like, Read More, Comment, Remove)

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Journal entry links navigate to wiki articles

steps.action: Click on wiki article link in journal entry (Test Article for Search)
steps.expected: Navigation to the wiki article page
steps.actual: Successfully navigated to wiki article page at /Wiki-Test/Test-Article-for-Search

observations: Journal entries include article title as clickable link, article summary, timestamp, and social actions (Like, Read More, Comment, Remove)
Journal entries show 'authored wiki article' as the activity type
Articles created in the Wiki module automatically appear in the user's Activity Feed

The Create Article dialog in the Wiki module had issues with the Publish button not responding to clicks during testing - article creation via UI was not successful, but existing articles that were previously created did have journal entries

Code review confirms Journal.Instance.AddWikiToJournal() is called when articles are created/published (NotificationServiceController.cs:447, ContentController.cs:190, RevisionsServiceController.cs:36)
